reviewText: The Savior (1971) French: Le sauveur is generally about 14-year-old Nanette (Muriel Catal) who falls in love with a middle-aged man who she finds injured near her family's farm in rural France. If I would have known that Muriel Catal was 18-years-old when the film was made, I wouldn't have been as shocked by the nude nymphet scenes, because Muriel easily passes for a 14-year-old. But that raises the question, is it okay for "older" actresses to play raunchy early-teen roles? The The Allure of Nymphets refers to the photographs in the November 2010 issue of GQ magazine that featured three stars of the Fox teen musical Glee. The Parents Television Council released a report saying that the GQ photographs sexualized actresses that play high school-aged students, bordered on pedophilia, and was nearly pornographic. GQ responded by saying that there was nothing wrong with the photographs due to the nature of sexualized modern television, and that the actresses were in their twenties. But is that a valid excuse? Where do we draw the line?
